title: Firefox not working
content:
Firefox has suddenly stopped working.

I tried opening previous session with a number of Tabs but they wouldn't load.

I uninstalled Firefox several times (and downloaded latest version several times, obvs) and now I have no history or previous sessions but websites still won't load.

I've cleared the cache several times via Preferences but this doesn't work.

I'm using latest version of Firefox on a 2015 MacBook Pro running up to date latest OS.

Please help.
creator: liberatortoo

title: Firefox for windows 8

title: Display of Log-in status (firefox-account)
content:
Hi, is there any URL under which I can see the current value of my sign-in/sign-off status (firefox-account)? Like the google account. Going to google.com shows my current log-in status. I dont know a comparable webpage with the firefox account.

Going to forinstance to https://www.mozilla.org/de/ always shows a sign-in link and does not show the current status. But I'm sure that I have to be already signed-in.

I'm not sure wether I was able to explain my question well enough, sorry.

title: Firefox logo I want to restore the tabs from my previous session, but Firefox won't let me
content:
For reasons unbeknownst to me*, Firefox started without restoring the tabs from my previous session. Exploring the forum for help, I found that menu "Help" > "Troubleshooting Information" will lead to a page on which one can find the profile folder, which in turn contains a folder called "sessionstore-backup," in which Firefox keeps a history of previous sessions' tabs.

While none of the files in that folder are intelligible, I can see from text snippets that a file called "upgrade.jsonlz4-20210504152106" is the only one that potentially holds a backup of my tabs. This file is just twelve days old. However, I cannot find a way to restore the tabs from that file as Firefox just keeps ignoring any changes that I make to the files name and folder contents. How can I restore my tabs from that file? when im useing "recovery.jsonlz4" on profile folder , i can see just white page on firefox and cant restore without anything but when i open it with notepad its true and have all url and tab
creator: a.reza907

content:

Thanks for your help!

title: How Do I stop Firefox from Resolving www.facebook.com
content:
I have put blockers in place (Layer 7 Firewall Rules, DNS dummy zones, etc.) yet facebook.com is still accessible from my Mozilla Firefox browser. How do I tell Firefox to use DNS like it's supposed to instead of some secret back-door into this Social Marketing rubbish? Microsoft Edge works just fine. I've not tried nor do I intend to use Google Chrome so that browser is not an issue. Just Firefox.

Is there some cache I need to clear in the infinite number of inane Firefox settings.

I would like to keep using Firefox if I can just tell it to do what I tell it. Uninstalling Firefox is killing a fly with a sledgehammer; and I don't want to do that.

Please help.
creator: randyf62003

title: Cannot access *.localhost
content:
Since Firefox 89 (maybe one or two releases before) *.localhost sites are not accessible, but those sites are available through other browsers or tools (Postman, Chrome, and Edge). Localhost is an Nginx server mounted on WSL2, so it’s IP does not correspond to 127.0.0.1 which is what Firefox thinks (about:networking#dnslookuptool).

There is no Proxy enabled. I also deleted the site settings on Firefox, disabled IPv6 and prefetch with no result.
creator: choncho

title: Two-level tabs stack
content:
